channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 14th October
item.description:
Rocking kerb Take up and relay kerb dropped kerb 900mmx150mm Standard TM required with fway closure Stat plan required (FW Kerbing Defects)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 14th October
item.description:

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 14th October

item.title: TMC - Defects - Road Markings problem, 14th October
item.description:
Road closure 28 day please refresh give way markings approximately 21 600x200mm dots plus x1 3 metres triangle plus x1 4 metre line (Faded Road Markings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 14th October
item.description:
Road closure 28 day please relay x1 sunken 900x150x40mm kerb stone stats required number 1 (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge encroaching onto footpath, 14th October
item.description:
The hedge that runs alongside the foot and cycle path is so overgrown that it covers the pedestrian side of the foot/cycle path. Consequently any pedestrians are forced to walk in the cycle lane side potentially casuing conflict or even accidents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7-12;14-21, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 14th October
item.description:
There are more potholes but my GPS signal was bad so couldn't get the words. But you get the gist.... the whole of this road is full of potholes and getting worse with the increased traffic.
Report on FixMyStreet
